quest.name: Emissary of the Dawn
journal: With thoughts of Alphinaud's plight weighing heavy on her mind, Alisaie might welcome some company.

Since there is naught to be done but wait for word from her brother, Alisaie suggests you take the opportunity to have tea together. No one seems to be sitting at the nearby table, so why not claim it while you wait for the kettle to boil.

After a pleasant while spent chatting with your fellow Scions, you are joined by Thancred, who proceeds to share the fruits of his investigation into Zenos's missing remains. Ascian involvement seems all but certain at this point, and Thancred offers to infiltrate the Empire's western provinces to seek out further information. With Y'shtola's time already committed to a scholarly expedition to Doma, Alisaie reluctantly agrees to hold the fort at the Rising Stones.
Your companions are poised to scatter to the winds once more. Alisaie stands by the entryway to the solar, a worried frown creasing her brow...

Promising to drop in and visit from time to time, you leave Alisaie to await word from Alphinaud. You can but pray that the light of the Crystal goes with him as he enters a realm steeped in Ascian shadow.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud will have need of all his wits if he is to survive his visit to Garlemald. We know precious little about life in the imperial capital.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's been an eventful few days, hasn't it. But I suppose all we can do now is wait for word from Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hmph. I don't recall the last time I had nothing pressing to be getting on with... We should probably make the most of it. Shall I put on some tea?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Tea would be lovely. You may regale me with the tale of your adventures in the Far East─and of your encounter with this new primal especially.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'll put the kettle on, then. That table looks free if you'd like to take a seat.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'll take care of the tea─you can claim us a table.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It is pronounced “Tsu-ku-yo-mi,” correct? A figure from Far Eastern mythology, no doubt...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon sitting at the table, several cutscenes will play in sequence.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 70 or above.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Sit at the table?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Interesting. So this Tsukuyomi was summoned in much the same manner as Susano─via the medium of a sacred relic.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That's right. They believe their gods─or kami─reside in physical objects.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Given the danger they represent, it may behoove us to begin a catalog of such relics. But if we are to contain the threat, we will require a better understanding of the summoning method itself. I believe I shall pay a visit to Doma, and learn what I can on the subject.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A fine idea. And I know for a fact that our friends in Doma would be grateful for any information which could help to prevent further summoning in the region.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I will pen you a letter of introduction─Lord Hien will wish to welcome our resident expert on aetherology.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Greetings! Could it be that I'm in time for tea?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It certainly looks that way. Come on─sit down and tell us how your investigations went.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: After you left, I went about questioning Bloodhowe's gravekeepers. They all told much the same story: once Lyse and her officers had confirmed Zenos dead, his corpse was interred under strict supervision.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: There seems little reason to doubt their testimony on that point, but when I mentioned the defacement of Zenos's grave, accounts grew rather more vague.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: None reported having seen any suspicious persons in the vicinity, and all assumed the act to have been perpetrated by a vengeful Ala Mhigan. Crucially, however, I was able to confirm that when the offending scrawl was removed, as per Lyse's instruction, no one involved thought to check the contents of the coffin. By that stage, 'tis like that the corpse was already missing.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Assuming Zenos has not, in fact, risen from the dead, we are left with two possibilities: either the body was disposed of to lend credence to the claims of an extremely committed impostor, or an Ascian has taken up residence within it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If Asahi was as fervent a devotee as you believe, he would not have been fooled by an impersonation, however committed. We must assume that we are dealing with an Ascian, and proceed accordingly.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Agreed. The question is, how many more such monsters are waiting for Alphinaud in Garlemald?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Their presence was his chief reason for going. He understood the risks. I only hope he did not underestimate the extent of the infestation...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, on the Imperial Hypersonic Assault Craft L-XXV...

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Master Alphinaud, we are making good speed towards our destination. Is aught amiss?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nay, 'tis just...I can see naught from my cabin, and was curious to know the land over which we flew.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Ah. I am afraid our military craft are built with little thought for such niceties. I am happy to indulge your curiosity, however. We are presently passing over the Burn on the western edge of Othard. Even with the benefit of a porthole, your gaze would have been greeted with naught but malms upon malms of lifeless earth.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I have read something of the Burn. It was described as a desolate wasteland, bled dry of every last drop of aether...

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Aye. It is believed that a succession of eikon summonings was responsible.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: When Emperor Solus first came to Othard and beheld this blight, he is said to have reeled at the scale of the devastation. He declared eikons a threat to our very star's existence, and issued an Empire-wide decree ordering the eradication of all such entities.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Hngh! Report!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALPILOT
dialogue.text: We're under attack, sir! Magitek armor─no visible designation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Magitek!? But who─?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Aaah!

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: All cannons, return fire! Damage report!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALPILOT
dialogue.text: The main reactor's been hit! Helm unresponsive! We're going down, sir!

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text:
Damn it! They knew exactly where to hit us.
All hands─brace for impact!

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Glad to have you back, Master Alphinaud. We have landed in one piece─more or less.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: But the air filtration system is damaged, and the ship is filling with smoke. We must gather the survivors and get out while we still can.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Aye... Aye.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Confound it! Not here. Not like this!

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Wha─? Who in the Emperor's name─?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Enemies of our enemies. Introductions can wait!

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: You are calm in a crisis, Master Alphinaud. Let us finish this, then!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: My thanks. Your intervention proved most timely.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text:
(-Menacing Mercenary-)Well, well...
I did not think to meet an Eorzean in this place, let alone a Scion.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You know of me, sir?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: (-Menacing Mercenary-)I have some small...history with your order.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: (-Menacing Mercenary-)But I would speak of the present. Know you your assailants? And the severity of your predicament?

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: The soldiers bore the insignia of the Emperor's personal guard...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And I could venture a guess as to their motive. But you yet have us at a disadvantage, sir─will you not tell us who you are?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: (-Menacing Mercenary-)Our names are not yours for the asking. And as for our purpose...let this be your answer.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: An Ascian mask!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: (-Menacing Mercenary-)The face of our prey.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: (-Menacing Mercenary-)We must away before more arrive. Come with us or stay, but make your choice now.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Even should we manage the long trek out of the Burn and secure passage to the capital, we would no doubt be greeted by the Emperor's guard...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text:
Indeed.
We accept your gracious offer, uh...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: (-Shadowhunter-)“Shadowhunter” will suffice for the present.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: (-Shadowhunter-)Come.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ugh, this is intolerable. But as much as I wish it were otherwise, there is nothing we can do for Alphinaud now but pray for his success.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well...that is not entirely true.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While your brother journeys to Garlemald from the east, I could make my way there from Ala Mhigo and find out what there is to be learned in the Empire's western provinces.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Then I'm coming with you! I can't very well sit here sipping tea if there's action to be taken!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Alisaie, but the provinces are hostile territory, and stealth is all important. It is safer that I go alone.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can sneak well enough when the situation demands it! Don't patronize me!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say to Alisaie?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We should leave this to Thancred.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'll go with him.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Not you too.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I understand your frustration, Alisaie, but Forename has the right of it. We must defer to Thancred's expertise in this matter.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And how exactly would that be any better?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ahem. I must refuse your company as well, my friend. Formidable though you are, the success of my mission depends on moving unnoticed, and lest you forget, you have grown rather famous. I trust you understand...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...Fine. Just promise you'll be careful.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well, I had best put on my skulking boots. There will be no room for mistakes once I've crossed the border from Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alisaie and her brother bicker as all siblings do, but she worries for him nonetheless. 'Twould be a kindness if you were to visit from time to time, and distract her from her cares.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
It seems that praying is to be the extent of my contribution after all.
...But I will stay behind, as I have been bid.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We all have our talents. Mine just happen to involve a silver tongue and soft soles. I promise to send word the moment I learn aught of consequence.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: See that you notify me too. I mean to depart for Doma as soon as I find a suitable East Aldenard vessel to bear me thither, but I shall return if I am needed.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Be sure to drop in whenever you're next in the area, Forename. With any luck, I'll have a painfully detailed report from Alphinaud to share.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have learned the emote Ponder!
